messages: e599c1b603ee72445d51a47df7a409dc (23:23): hi all... i did rm -rf /opt/csw in to remove blastwave and then reinstalled it, evidently that didn't cut it cuz now pkg-get believes there is stuff installed that isn't ... any advise?
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (23:25): yes | pkgrm `pkginfo |grep CSW | awk '{ print $2 }'`
e599c1b603ee72445d51a47df7a409dc (23:27): Auralis: ty... i'm running that
1bb7a809ed56ff413102dba7b1c22d2c (23:33): hi there.

e599c1b603ee72445d51a47df7a409dc (23:36): i have an issue with USB keys... I'm trying one that worked perfect under nv_24 in this same box... now it won't mount... it seems solaries believes they are 0.00 mb in size... what could i try to make it work?
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:00): Does anyone know what fc-cache does?
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:00): Except for causing 90% iowait?
e599c1b603ee72445d51a47df7a409dc (00:01): font caching
e599c1b603ee72445d51a47df7a409dc (00:01): font something caching
e599c1b603ee72445d51a47df7a409dc (00:01): i had the same issue when i first installed sx
2b9d13217ca1d39934ebc86a4be0924f (00:01): fontconfig uses cache files to speed up font search
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:01): iowait is idle CPU that nobody else but processes waiting for IO would want to use, afaik?

246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:02): Oh, mine is from blastwave actually - I'm doing a 'pkg-get upgrade' on a much neglected blastwave collection and it's turning more and more interesting in the Chinese sense of the word.
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:02): andersmo: yes, that sounds about right.
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:03): (so if there were any CPU-hungry processes, iowait would be 0)
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:03): Thus, in and of itself, iowait isn't a problem - it's free CPU that nobody wants.
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:03): The load got so high on my machine that my SunRay would throw up the blue square with an hourglass.
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:03): But it's an indication that your IO subsystem is a bottleneck.
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:03): andersmo: I beg to differ on the 'not a problem' part :)
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:04): Ask iostat which disk is 100% blocking =)
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:04): Oh, I don't need to ask, I've only got one :-p
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:05): Well, ok 2, mirror pair in an SB100.
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:05): http://www.xfree86.org/current/fc-cache.1.html - if we're talking about the same fc-cache, it's indexing.
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:06): And it sounds like something that could cause some pretty heavy random io load. =)
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:06): 'Does not play well with others' - it'll have to postpone the the indexing.
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:07): It's a pain on the first run, but you'll probably benefit from it later. =)
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:11): And, err.. how long should it take?
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:11): I don't like my sunray going on and off.
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:14): Hello? Am I still here?
2b9d13217ca1d39934ebc86a4be0924f (00:15): I've never seen it take more than 45 seconds on a real disk
2b9d13217ca1d39934ebc86a4be0924f (00:15): with several dozen fonts installed
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:18): Now I'vearted gaim - 13% CPU, everythin elkse IOWAIT
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:18): sorry for typos, typing
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:19): blind rit now
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:19): pkill -STOP fc-cache and see if things ease? =)
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:22): Something's seriously wrong with the new blastwave I got, perhaps: now gaim is 1165MB in size, iowait is 85%. I killed fc-cache long ago.
3f9e24f372de1c18c3993ee5f9f1adcd (00:23): hm. swap trashing hell?
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (00:26): If that stuff starts before the font caches exist, it tends to behave badly.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (00:27): perhaps run fc-cache -v, wait it out, then restart the stuff that maybe making use of it?
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:28): Thanks, richlowe.
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:28): fc-cache seems to go wierd in /usr/openwin/lib/X11/fonts/misc
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (00:30): Once it goes in there, it uses more memory than I've got (640MB) and my SunRay session goes nonresponsive.
26d9e44dee73e524f49ca70b8b039402 (00:39): Ich habe OpenSolaris gern.
26d9e44dee73e524f49ca70b8b039402 (00:41): English is only?
26d9e44dee73e524f49ca70b8b039402 (00:41): How close to OpenSolaris on mine x86 laptop with ACPI or APM suspend to memory?
26d9e44dee73e524f49ca70b8b039402 (00:42): I am new for English.
26d9e44dee73e524f49ca70b8b039402 (00:43): Do Solaris have ACPI?
75dd2071a30b7c94d9361f05f06d524c (00:46): yes. solaris supports acpi
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (00:46): ACPI is more than just power management.
75dd2071a30b7c94d9361f05f06d524c (00:47): bear in mind that at some point in the early nevada builds they switched over to the intel acpi ca, iirc
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (00:47): 10 and Nevada support all the bits that aren't power related.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (00:47): suspend/resume is being worked on, I believe.
b8ac460f16efd92d9e259415a4930199 (00:53): does anyone know if ati is working on drivers for solaris 10?
246c3b99c9da4707df319c508d66a22a (01:01): Ok, it's official: anything gnome I got from blastwave is dead.
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (01:01): heh, thats the default setting for gnome, from anywhere :)
b8ac460f16efd92d9e259415a4930199 (01:02): jds3 was not so bad for a gnome 2.6
